oai_dc:dc.dc:title: 1908 edition of Rhea and Meigs Counties in the Confederate War by V. C. Allen
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Inscribed to John Spence, his nephew, who writes on the fly leaf of a [1913] flood of the Tennessee River in which as a two-week old baby he was carried to safety by his uncle. Title page of this pro-Confederate account of these two counties during the war shows a Stars and Bars flag and the inscription "No nation ever rose so fair, None fell so free of crime."
